page.title: 15A Typical Working Day
page.content: It's 7 a.m. and the trains to London are already rumbling past the end of Station Road where I live. My daughter drives off to her job in Wembley, my son goes to school in Snaresbrook, my husband walks to his{business}nearby and I stroll to Loughton High School. I spend my day{teaching}Business Studies, emerging again at 4 p.m. to call for my mother in Lower Park Road and take her to the library in Traps Hill. At 6 p.m. I drive to Sainsbury's in Chingford to buy the week's groceries because I do not like Loughton's one and only{supermarket. The rest of the evening will be spent at home marking, reading or watching TV with the family .
